means: （因痛苦、气愤、兴奋等的）短而尖的叫声

sentence.Network_en: I had to bite back a yelp of surprise.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只好强忍住，没惊叫出来。

sentence.Network_en: She jumped back with a little yelp of surprise.
sentence.Network_cn: 她吃惊地喊叫了一声跳了回去.

sentence.Network_en: His laughter was cathartic, an animal yelp that brought tears to his eyes.
sentence.Network_cn: 他哈哈大笑以宣泄情绪，声音如野兽般尖厉，眼泪都笑出来了。

list.abs: Just a very yelp as if some tiny person was calling for help ., 只是一个很微弱的声音 , 好像有个很小的人在求救.
and the sea yelp , are different voices ., 和海的叫喊 , 是不同的声音.
Just a very faint yelp as if some tiny person was calling for help ., 只是一个很微弱的声音 , 好像有个很小的人在求救.
the dog yelped and ran away ., 狗汪汪叫着跑开了.
The dog yelped and ran off ., 那狗叫着跑开了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English g(i)elpan (verb) 'to boast', from a Germanic imitative base. From late Middle English 'cry or sing with a loud voice' the current sense arose in the 16th cent

entry.tran: （通常因害怕或痛楚）尖叫;（狗）嚎叫
entry.def: If a person or dog yelps, they give a sudden short cry, often because of fear or pain.

example.ex: Her dog yelped and came to heel.
example.tran: 她的狗汪地叫了一声，紧跟了上来。

means.word_mean: 1. a sharp high-pitched cry (especially by a dog)

auth_sentence.content: Writers yelp vainly when directors muscle in on their screen credits.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Writers yelp vainly when directors muscle in on their screen credits.

auth_sentence.content: One reviewer on the Web site yelp.com said there's another bonus to the train.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: One reviewer on the Web site yelp.com said there's another bonus to the train.

auth_sentence.content: Even the toughest in the crew couldn't help an occasional yelp as some new horror was illuminated by their head torch.

sentences.cn: 她吃惊地喊叫了一声跳了回去。

sentences.en: A hound yelped briefly as a whip cracked.
sentences.cn: 鞭子一响，猎狗发出一阵嗥叫。
